text: is the capital city of Miyagi Prefecture, Japan. It is the largest city in the Tōhoku Region. Sendai is also called the . About 1,045,986 people live in the city as of 2010. Date Masamune built the castle at Sendai in 1601. The modern- day city of Sendai developed around it.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Date Masamune" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 148-149. On March 11, 2011, an earthquake and a tsunami badly damaged the city and its surroundings. is in nearby Natori, Miyagi, south southeast of Sendai Station. The airport was badly damaged by the tsunami, but re-opened for limited service the next month. The US State Department said the airport was safe to visit. There are several ski resorts and golf clubs in Sendai. The football club Vegalta Sendai has its stadium in the city.
